com.ansca.corona
Class CoronaEnvironment

java.lang.Object
  com.ansca.corona.CoronaEnvironment

public final class CoronaEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object

Provides simple methods for launching and accessing a CoronaActivity as well as setting up listeners for receiving events from the Corona runtime.

All methods in this class are thread safe and can be called from any thread.

You cannot make instances of this class. Access is provided via static methods.

Method Detail

getDocumentsDirectory

public static java.io.File getDocumentsDirectory(android.content.Context context)
Gets the path to Corona's documents directory.

This is the directory that Lua property "system.DocumentsDirectory" maps to.

This directory is located in internal storage.

Parameters:
context - Context needed to access this application's directories. Cannot be null.
Returns:
Returns a File object set to the specified directory.

getTemporaryDirectory

public static java.io.File getTemporaryDirectory(android.content.Context context)
Gets the path to Corona's temporary directory.

This is the directory that Lua property "system.TemporaryDirectory" maps to.

This directory is located in internal storage. Its files will be automatically deleted by the operating system if internal storage is low on space.

Parameters:
context - Context needed to access this application's directories. Cannot be null.
Returns:
Returns a File object set to the specified directory.

getCachesDirectory

public static java.io.File getCachesDirectory(android.content.Context context)
Gets the path to Corona's caches directory.

This is the directory that Lua property "system.CachesDirectory" maps to.

This directory is located in internal storage. Its files will be automatically deleted by the operating system if internal storage is low on space.

Parameters:
context - Context needed to access this application's directories. Cannot be null.
Returns:
Returns a File object set to the specified directory.

showCoronaActivity

public static void showCoronaActivity(android.content.Context context)
Displays the Corona activity window on screen. If the Corona activity is currently suspended in the background, then this method will bring it to the foreground.

Parameters:
context - The context derived object needed to display the Corona activity via intents. Cannot be null.

getCoronaActivity

public static CoronaActivity getCoronaActivity()
Gets a reference to the currently active Corona activity.

Returns:
Returns a reference to the currently activie Corona activity object. Returns null if the activity was never created or has been destroyed.

getApplicationContext

public static android.content.Context getApplicationContext()
Provides easy access to this application's context.

Returns:
Returns an instance of the application context object. Returns null if this application has not been fully initialized yet.

getLuaErrorHandler

public static JavaFunction getLuaErrorHandler()
Gets the custom Lua error handler that was given to the CoronaEnvironment.setLuaErrorHandler() method.

Returns:
Returns a reference to a custom Lua error handler. This is a Lua function that is implemented in Java.

Returns null if a custom error handler was not set. In this case, Corona will use its default error handling.

setLuaErrorHandler

public static void setLuaErrorHandler(JavaFunction handler)
Sets a custom handler for Lua errors, such as syntax or runtime errors.

Parameters:
handler - Reference to the custom Lua error handler. This is a Lua function that is implemented in Java.

Set to null to use Corona's default error handler.

addRuntimeListener

public static void addRuntimeListener(CoronaRuntimeListener listener)
Adds a listener for receiving events from the Corona runtime.

Parameters:
listener - The listener that will receive events. Cannot be null.
See Also:
CoronaRuntimeListener

removeRuntimeListener

public static void removeRuntimeListener(CoronaRuntimeListener listener)
Removes the given listener that was added via the addRuntimeListener() method.

Parameters:
listener - The listener object to be removed by reference.
See Also:
CoronaRuntimeListener
